intro: Urvillea cuchujaquensis, commonly known as the Cuchujaquén cactus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its structure includes areoles, which are specialized structures that bear spines, flowers, and sometimes branches. Urvillea cuchujaquensis plays a role in local ecosystems by providing shelter and food for various desert animals.
